api_endpoints.name: get-/conversations/v3/conversations/inboxes

wrapper_tool.name: list_conversation_inboxes

description.tagline: Retrieve a list of conversation inboxes.
description.detailed: This tool fetches a list of conversation inboxes, allowing for optional filters and sorting to customize the results.

wrapper_tool.return_annotation: List of conversation inboxes with optional filters and sorting.

api_endpoints.description: Retrieve a list of conversations inboxes, with optional filters and sorting.

api_endpoints.name: get-/conversations/v3/conversations/threads/{threadId}

wrapper_tool.name: retrieve_thread_by_id

description.tagline: Retrieve detailed information about a conversation thread by ID.
description.detailed: Use this to access specific conversation threads and their details for a given thread ID.

wrapper_tool.return_annotation: Detailed information about a specific conversation thread.

arguments.name: conversation_thread_id
arguments.description: The unique identifier for the conversation thread you wish to retrieve. Provide the specific thread ID to access its details.

api_endpoints.description: Retrieve a single thread by its ID

api_endpoints.name: delete-/conversations/v3/conversations/threads/{threadId}

wrapper_tool.name: archive_conversation_thread

description.tagline: Archives a conversation thread, marking it for deletion.
description.detailed: Use this tool to archive a conversation thread, which will then be permanently deleted after 30 days. Ideal for managing conversational data efficiently by removing unnecessary threads.

wrapper_tool.return_annotation: Confirmation of thread archiving.

arguments.name: thread_identifier
arguments.description: The unique identifier of the conversation thread to archive. This is a required field and should match the specific thread you wish to archive.

api_endpoints.description: Archives a single thread. The thread will be permanently deleted 30 days after placed in an archived state.

api_endpoints.name: patch-/conversations/v3/conversations/threads/{threadId}

wrapper_tool.name: update_conversation_thread

description.tagline: Update the status or restore a conversation thread.
description.detailed: This tool updates a single thread's status or restores it within Hubspot Conversations. Use it to change the status or restore a thread based on the thread ID provided.

wrapper_tool.return_annotation: Confirmation of thread update or restoration.

arguments.name: thread_identifier
arguments.description: The unique identifier for the conversation thread to update or restore.

arguments.name: thread_status
arguments.description: Set the thread's status to `OPEN` or `CLOSED`.

arguments.name: is_thread_archived
arguments.description: Set to true to archive or false to restore the thread. Determines if the thread is currently archived.

api_endpoints.description: Updates a single thread. Either a thread's status can be updated, or the thread can be restored.

body.name: archived

value_schema.description: Whether this thread is archived. Set to false to restore the thread.

body.description: Whether this thread is archived. Set to false to restore the thread.

json_schema.description: Whether this thread is archived. Set to false to restore the thread.

api_endpoints.name: get-/conversations/v3/conversations/threads/{threadId}/messages/{messageId}/original-content

wrapper_tool.name: retrieve_full_message_content

description.tagline: Retrieve the original text and rich text of a HubSpot message.
description.detailed: Use this tool to access the full original content of a message within a conversation on HubSpot. Ideal for retrieving untruncated message details when the truncation status indicates it might be truncated.

wrapper_tool.return_annotation: Original text and rich text of a message.

arguments.name: conversation_thread_id
arguments.description: The unique identifier for the conversation thread containing the message.

arguments.name: message_id
arguments.description: The unique identifier for the message. Used to retrieve the message's full original content.

api_endpoints.summary: Get the original content of a single message
api_endpoints.description: Returns the complete original text and rich text bodies of a message. This will be different from the text and rich text in the message itself if the message's `truncationStatus` is anything other than `NOT_TRUNCATED`.

api_endpoints.name: get-/conversations/v3/conversations/channels

wrapper_tool.name: list_conversation_channels

description.tagline: Retrieve a list of conversation channels from Hubspot.
description.detailed: Use this tool to get a list of conversation channels from Hubspot, applying optional filters and sorting if needed.

wrapper_tool.return_annotation: A list of conversation channels with available filters and sorting.

api_endpoints.description: Retrieve a list of channels, with optional filters and sorting.

api_endpoints.name: get-/conversations/v3/conversations/actors/{actorId}

wrapper_tool.name: retrieve_actor_details

description.tagline: Retrieve details of a specific actor by actor ID.
description.detailed: Use this tool to get information about a specific actor within Hubspot Conversations by providing their actor ID. It should be called when actor-specific details are needed.

wrapper_tool.return_annotation: Actor details for the specified actor ID.

arguments.name: actor_id
arguments.description: The unique identifier for the actor whose details are to be retrieved.

api_endpoints.description: Retrieve details of a single actor using the actor ID.

api_endpoints.name: get-/conversations/v3/conversations/threads

wrapper_tool.name: retrieve_conversation_threads

description.tagline: Retrieve conversation threads from Hubspot Conversations.
description.detailed: Use this tool to fetch a list of conversation threads from Hubspot Conversations. You can apply optional filters and sorting to tailor the results.

wrapper_tool.return_annotation: List of conversation threads with optional filters and sorting.

api_endpoints.description: Retrieve a list of threads, with optional filters and sorting.

api_endpoints.name: get-/conversations/v3/conversations/threads/{threadId}/messages

wrapper_tool.name: get_message_history_for_thread

description.tagline: Retrieve the message history for a specific thread.
description.detailed: This tool retrieves the message history for a given conversation thread by its ID. It should be used when you need to access past messages of a thread in Hubspot Conversations.

wrapper_tool.return_annotation: The message history for a specific conversation thread.

arguments.name: thread_id
arguments.description: The unique identifier for the conversation thread whose message history is to be retrieved.

api_endpoints.summary: Get message history for a thread
api_endpoints.description: Retrieve the message history for a specific thread.

api_endpoints.name: post-/conversations/v3/conversations/threads/{threadId}/messages

wrapper_tool.name: send_conversation_message

description.tagline: Send a new message in a conversation thread.
description.detailed: Use this tool to send a new message on an existing conversation thread. Ideal for continuing discussions or replying within a thread.

wrapper_tool.return_annotation: Confirmation of message sent in the conversation thread.

arguments.name: thread_id
arguments.description: The unique identifier for the conversation thread where the message will be sent. It should be a string that corresponds to the existing thread ID in Hubspot.

arguments.name: message_content
arguments.description: The content of the message to be sent within the thread. Provide this as a JSON object containing the message text and any relevant metadata.

api_endpoints.summary: Send a message to a thread
api_endpoints.description: Send a new message on a thread at the current timestamp.

type.description: The type of identifier. HS_EMAIL_ADDRESS for email addresses; HS_PHONE_NUMBER for a phone number; CHANNEL_SPECIFIC_OPAQUE_ID for channels that use their own proprietary identifiers, like Facebook Messenger or LiveChat.

value.description: A string representation of the PublicDeliveryIdentifier, either an an E.164 phone number, an email address, or a channel-specific identifier.

type.description: The type of identifier. HS_EMAIL_ADDRESS for email addresses; HS_PHONE_NUMBER for a phone number; CHANNEL_SPECIFIC_OPAQUE_ID for channels that use their own proprietary identifiers, like Facebook Messenger or LiveChat.

value.description: A string representation of the PublicDeliveryIdentifier, either an an E.164 phone number, an email address, or a channel-specific identifier.

api_endpoints.name: post-/conversations/v3/conversations/actors/batch/read

wrapper_tool.name: resolve_conversation_actors

description.tagline: Resolve ActorIds to conversation participants.
description.detailed: Use this tool to retrieve detailed information about participants in a conversation given their ActorIds. Typically called when there's a need to understand who the participants in a conversation are by resolving their IDs.

wrapper_tool.return_annotation: Details of actors/participants from given ActorIds.

arguments.name: actor_ids
arguments.description: A list of Actor IDs to resolve into detailed participant information. Each entry should be a string representing an Actor ID.

api_endpoints.description: Resolve a set of `ActorId`s to the underlying actors/participants.

api_endpoints.name: get-/conversations/v3/conversations/channel-accounts/{channelAccountId}

wrapper_tool.name: get_channel_account_details

description.tagline: Retrieve details of a HubSpot channel account by ID.
description.detailed: Fetches detailed information about a specific HubSpot channel account using the channel account ID. Use this tool to obtain information about a channel account, such as its status and configuration.

wrapper_tool.return_annotation: Channel account details based on the provided ID.

arguments.name: channel_account_id
arguments.description: The unique ID of the HubSpot channel account to retrieve details for. This ID is required to fetch the channel account's information.

api_endpoints.description: Retrieve details of a single channel account using the channel account ID.

api_endpoints.name: get-/conversations/v3/conversations/channel-accounts

wrapper_tool.name: retrieve_channel_accounts

description.tagline: Retrieve a list of channel accounts from Hubspot.
description.detailed: This tool calls the Hubspot Conversations API to retrieve a list of channel accounts. It supports optional filters and sorting to refine the results.

wrapper_tool.return_annotation: List of channel accounts with optional filters and sorting.

api_endpoints.description: Retrieve a list of channel accounts, with optional filters and sorting.

api_endpoints.name: get-/conversations/v3/conversations/channels/{channelId}

wrapper_tool.name: retrieve_channel_details

description.tagline: Retrieve details of a channel using its ID.
description.detailed: Use this tool to get comprehensive details about a specific channel in Hubspot Conversations by providing the channel ID.

wrapper_tool.return_annotation: Details of a specific channel by ID.

arguments.name: channel_id
arguments.description: The unique ID of the channel to retrieve details for in Hubspot Conversations.

api_endpoints.description: Retrieve details of a single channel using the channel ID.

api_endpoints.name: get-/conversations/v3/conversations/inboxes/{inboxId}

wrapper_tool.name: get_inbox_details

description.tagline: Retrieve details of a conversation inbox by ID.
description.detailed: Use this tool to obtain detailed information about a specific conversation inbox by providing the inbox ID.

wrapper_tool.return_annotation: Details of a specific conversation inbox.

arguments.name: inbox_id
arguments.description: The unique identifier for the conversation inbox you wish to retrieve details for. It should be a string representing the inbox ID.

api_endpoints.description: Retrieve details of a single conversations inbox using the inbox ID.

api_endpoints.name: get-/conversations/v3/conversations/threads/{threadId}/messages/{messageId}

wrapper_tool.name: retrieve_thread_message

description.tagline: Retrieve a single message from a conversation thread.
description.detailed: Call this tool to get the details of a specific message within a conversation thread using the message ID. Useful for accessing conversation content for review or processing.

wrapper_tool.return_annotation: Details of a specific message from a conversation thread.

arguments.name: thread_id
arguments.description: The unique identifier of the conversation thread from which to retrieve the message.

arguments.name: message_id
arguments.description: The unique identifier for the specific message within a thread. Used to retrieve message details.

api_endpoints.description: Retrieve a single message from a thread using the message ID.

api_endpoints.name: get-/conversations/v3/custom-channels/{channelId}
api_endpoints.description: Retrieve the details about a custom channel. This API allows you to see a custom channel's current capabilties and other configuration metadata

api_endpoints.name: delete-/conversations/v3/custom-channels/{channelId}
api_endpoints.description: Archive an existing registered custom channel

api_endpoints.name: patch-/conversations/v3/custom-channels/{channelId}
api_endpoints.description: Update the capabilities for an existing. You can also use it to update the channel's webhookUri and its channelAccountConnectionRedirectUrl.

api_endpoints.name: get-/conversations/v3/custom-channels/{channelId}/messages/{messageId}

wrapper_tool.name: get_custom_channel_message_details

description.tagline: Retrieve details for a specific message in a custom channel.
description.detailed: Use this tool to get the details of a specific message sent through a custom channel in Hubspot Conversations. Ideal for obtaining message content, sender information, and timestamps.

wrapper_tool.return_annotation: Details of a specific message in a custom channel.

arguments.name: channel_id
arguments.description: The unique identifier for the custom channel from which the message was sent. Required to fetch specific message details.

arguments.name: message_id
arguments.description: The unique identifier of the message to retrieve details for. This ID is used to specify the exact message in the custom channel.

api_endpoints.description: Get the details for a specific message sent over a custom channel

api_endpoints.name: patch-/conversations/v3/custom-channels/{channelId}/messages/{messageId}

wrapper_tool.name: update_message_status

description.tagline: Update the status of a conversation message.
description.detailed: Use this tool to update the status of a message within a custom channel on Hubspot Conversations. It indicates whether a message was successfully sent, failed, or read. Additionally, for failed messages, you can include an error message for clarification.

wrapper_tool.return_annotation: Details of the updated message status.

arguments.name: channel_identifier
arguments.description: The unique identifier for the custom channel where the message is located. It is required to specify which channel the message belongs to.

arguments.name: message_id
arguments.description: Unique identifier of the message to be updated.

arguments.name: message_status
arguments.description: Specifies the status of the message. Valid values are SENT, FAILED, and READ.

arguments.name: error_message_for_failed_status
arguments.description: Provide an error message when the status is FAILED to clarify the reason for failure. Only use this when 'statusType' is 'FAILED'.

api_endpoints.description: Update a message's status to indicate if it was successfully sent, failed to send, or was read. For failed messages, this can also include the error message for the failure.

body.name: statusType

value_schema.description: Valid status are SENT, FAILED, and READ

body.description: Valid status are SENT, FAILED, and READ

json_schema.description: Valid status are SENT, FAILED, and READ

api_endpoints.name: patch-/conversations/v3/custom-channels/{channelId}/channel-account-staging-tokens/{accountToken}

wrapper_tool.name: update_channel_account_staging

description.tagline: Update channel account staging token details for public apps.
description.detailed: This tool updates the account name and delivery identifier of a channel account staging token in Hubspot Conversations. Use it when you need to modify these details for a specific channel account created from a staging token.

wrapper_tool.return_annotation: Updated channel account staging token details.

arguments.name: channel_id
arguments.description: The unique identifier for the channel to update. This is necessary to specify which channel's staging token details are being modified.

arguments.name: account_token
arguments.description: The unique token identifying the specific channel account staging. Required for updating account details.

arguments.name: account_name
arguments.description: The name of the account to be updated for the channel account staging token.

arguments.name: delivery_identifier_type
arguments.description: Type of delivery identifier: HS_EMAIL_ADDRESS, HS_PHONE_NUMBER, or CHANNEL_SPECIFIC_OPAQUE_ID.

arguments.name: delivery_identifier_value
arguments.description: The PublicDeliveryIdentifier in string format, such as an E.164 phone number, an email address, or a channel-specific identifier.

api_endpoints.summary: Update a channel account staging token
api_endpoints.description: Update a channel account staging token's account name and delivery identifier. This information will be applied to the channel account created from this staging token. This is used for public apps.

body.name: deliveryIdentifier.type

value_schema.description: The type of identifier. HS_EMAIL_ADDRESS for email addresses; HS_PHONE_NUMBER for a phone number; CHANNEL_SPECIFIC_OPAQUE_ID for channels that use their own proprietary identifiers, like Facebook Messenger or LiveChat.

body.description: The type of identifier. HS_EMAIL_ADDRESS for email addresses; HS_PHONE_NUMBER for a phone number; CHANNEL_SPECIFIC_OPAQUE_ID for channels that use their own proprietary identifiers, like Facebook Messenger or LiveChat.

json_schema.description: The type of identifier. HS_EMAIL_ADDRESS for email addresses; HS_PHONE_NUMBER for a phone number; CHANNEL_SPECIFIC_OPAQUE_ID for channels that use their own proprietary identifiers, like Facebook Messenger or LiveChat.

body.name: deliveryIdentifier.value

value_schema.description: A string representation of the PublicDeliveryIdentifier, either an an E.164 phone number, an email address, or a channel-specific identifier.

body.description: A string representation of the PublicDeliveryIdentifier, either an an E.164 phone number, an email address, or a channel-specific identifier.

json_schema.description: A string representation of the PublicDeliveryIdentifier, either an an E.164 phone number, an email address, or a channel-specific identifier.

api_endpoints.name: get-/conversations/v3/custom-channels/{channelId}/channel-accounts

wrapper_tool.name: get_custom_channel_accounts

description.tagline: Retrieve accounts for a specified custom channel.
description.detailed: This tool is used to fetch a list of accounts associated with a specific custom channel in Hubspot Conversations, identified by the channel ID.

wrapper_tool.return_annotation: List of accounts for the specified custom channel.

arguments.name: custom_channel_id
arguments.description: The unique identifier of the custom channel to retrieve accounts for. Must be a valid string.

api_endpoints.description: Retrieve a list of accounts for a custom channel.

api_endpoints.name: post-/conversations/v3/custom-channels/{channelId}/channel-accounts

wrapper_tool.name: create_channel_account

description.tagline: Create a new account for a specified communication channel.
description.detailed: This tool is used to create a new account within a specific communication channel using Hubspot. It enables multiple accounts to communicate over a single channel with different delivery identifiers.

wrapper_tool.return_annotation: Confirmation of account creation for a channel.

arguments.name: channel_id
arguments.description: The unique identifier for the communication channel where the account will be created. This should be a string value.

arguments.name: account_name
arguments.description: The name of the account to be created for the channel. It identifies the account within the specified communication channel.

arguments.name: inbox_id
arguments.description: The unique identifier for the inbox where the channel account will be created. This should be a string that corresponds to an existing inbox in Hubspot.

arguments.name: is_authorized
arguments.description: Boolean to indicate if the account should be authorized. Set to true for authorized accounts, false otherwise.

arguments.name: delivery_identifier_type
arguments.description: Type of identifier: HS_EMAIL_ADDRESS, HS_PHONE_NUMBER, or CHANNEL_SPECIFIC_OPAQUE_ID.

arguments.name: delivery_identifier_value
arguments.description: A string representation of the delivery identifier. Can be an E.164 phone number, an email address, or a channel-specific identifier.

api_endpoints.description: Create a new account for a channel. Multiple accounts can communicate over a single channel using different delivery identifiers.

body.name: deliveryIdentifier.type

value_schema.description: The type of identifier. HS_EMAIL_ADDRESS for email addresses; HS_PHONE_NUMBER for a phone number; CHANNEL_SPECIFIC_OPAQUE_ID for channels that use their own proprietary identifiers, like Facebook Messenger or LiveChat.

body.description: The type of identifier. HS_EMAIL_ADDRESS for email addresses; HS_PHONE_NUMBER for a phone number; CHANNEL_SPECIFIC_OPAQUE_ID for channels that use their own proprietary identifiers, like Facebook Messenger or LiveChat.

json_schema.description: The type of identifier. HS_EMAIL_ADDRESS for email addresses; HS_PHONE_NUMBER for a phone number; CHANNEL_SPECIFIC_OPAQUE_ID for channels that use their own proprietary identifiers, like Facebook Messenger or LiveChat.

body.name: deliveryIdentifier.value

value_schema.description: A string representation of the PublicDeliveryIdentifier, either an an E.164 phone number, an email address, or a channel-specific identifier.

body.description: A string representation of the PublicDeliveryIdentifier, either an an E.164 phone number, an email address, or a channel-specific identifier.

json_schema.description: A string representation of the PublicDeliveryIdentifier, either an an E.164 phone number, an email address, or a channel-specific identifier.

api_endpoints.name: get-/conversations/v3/custom-channels/{channelId}/channel-accounts/{channelAccountId}

wrapper_tool.name: retrieve_channel_account_details

description.tagline: Retrieve details for a specific channel account.
description.detailed: Use this tool to get detailed metadata about a channel account, including its channel, inbox ID, and delivery identifiers. Ideal for understanding the configuration and associations of a channel account in Hubspot.

wrapper_tool.return_annotation: Details of a specific channel account including metadata and identifiers.

arguments.name: channel_identifier
arguments.description: The unique identifier for the channel. Used to specify which channel's account details to retrieve.

arguments.name: channel_account_id
arguments.description: Unique identifier for the specific channel account to retrieve details about. Provided as a string.

api_endpoints.summary: Get a channel account by id
api_endpoints.description: Retrieve the details for a specific channel account. This contains all the metadata about your channel account, including its channel, associated inbox id, and delivery identifier information.

api_endpoints.name: patch-/conversations/v3/custom-channels/{channelId}/channel-accounts/{channelAccountId}

wrapper_tool.name: update_channel_account_info

description.tagline: Update channel account name and authorization status.
description.detailed: Use this tool to modify the name and authorization status of a channel account in Hubspot Conversations. This is useful for managing channel accounts, including disabling them by setting the isAuthorized flag to False.

wrapper_tool.return_annotation: Confirmation of channel account update status.

arguments.name: channel_id
arguments.description: The unique identifier for the channel in Hubspot Conversations. Required to specify which channel account to update.

arguments.name: channel_account_id
arguments.description: The unique identifier for the channel account to be updated. It is required for specifying which channel account to modify.

arguments.name: channel_account_name
arguments.description: The new name for the channel account. This updates the display name associated with the account.

arguments.name: set_authorization_status
arguments.description: Boolean value to update the channel account's authorization. Set to False to disable the account.

api_endpoints.description: This API is used to update the name of the channel account and it's isAuthorized status. Setting to isAuthorized flag to False disables the channel account.

api_endpoints.name: get-/conversations/v3/custom-channels/
api_endpoints.description: Retrieve all custom channels associated with the app.

api_endpoints.name: post-/conversations/v3/custom-channels/
api_endpoints.description: Register a new channel along with its capabilities and the webhook url that will be used to receive messages published over the channel

api_endpoints.name: post-/conversations/v3/custom-channels/{channelId}/messages

wrapper_tool.name: publish_custom_channel_message

description.tagline: Publish a message to a custom channel on HubSpot.
description.detailed: This tool sends a message over a specified custom channel in HubSpot Conversations. Use this tool to communicate via custom-integrated messaging channels.

wrapper_tool.return_annotation: Confirms successful publishing of the message.

arguments.name: custom_channel_id
arguments.description: The unique ID of the custom channel where the message will be published. Must be a string.

arguments.name: custom_channel_message_payload
arguments.description: A JSON object containing message details for the custom channel, including message direction, recipients, senders, text, and attachments.

api_endpoints.description: Publish a message over your custom channel

type.description: The type of identifier. HS_EMAIL_ADDRESS for email addresses; HS_PHONE_NUMBER for a phone number; CHANNEL_SPECIFIC_OPAQUE_ID for channels that use their own proprietary identifiers, like Facebook Messenger or LiveChat.

value.description: A string representation of the PublicDeliveryIdentifier, either an an E.164 phone number, an email address, or a channel-specific identifier.

type.description: The type of identifier. HS_EMAIL_ADDRESS for email addresses; HS_PHONE_NUMBER for a phone number; CHANNEL_SPECIFIC_OPAQUE_ID for channels that use their own proprietary identifiers, like Facebook Messenger or LiveChat.

value.description: A string representation of the PublicDeliveryIdentifier, either an an E.164 phone number, an email address, or a channel-specific identifier.

type.description: The type of identifier. HS_EMAIL_ADDRESS for email addresses; HS_PHONE_NUMBER for a phone number; CHANNEL_SPECIFIC_OPAQUE_ID for channels that use their own proprietary identifiers, like Facebook Messenger or LiveChat.

value.description: A string representation of the PublicDeliveryIdentifier, either an an E.164 phone number, an email address, or a channel-specific identifier.

type.description: The type of identifier. HS_EMAIL_ADDRESS for email addresses; HS_PHONE_NUMBER for a phone number; CHANNEL_SPECIFIC_OPAQUE_ID for channels that use their own proprietary identifiers, like Facebook Messenger or LiveChat.

value.description: A string representation of the PublicDeliveryIdentifier, either an an E.164 phone number, an email address, or a channel-specific identifier.

scopes.conversations.custom_channels.read: Read messages and manage Channel Accounts for an included Custom Channel.
scopes.conversations.custom_channels.write: Publish messages into HubSpot and manage Channel Accounts for an included Custom Channel.
